You are the first person I've ever seen ask this question, so you may
be treading on virgin ground here.

You look like you're trying to test whether you're using the C library
correctly. Mocking the library sounds like a good idea, and you have an
interesting technique for doing that. I don't understand this
paragraph:

>What I dislike is that my tests are in fact splitted into the JUnit 
>test case part and the C dummy library part and I would prefer them to

>be just JUnit tests.

You wrote that your tests were all written with JUnit, so I don't
understand this statement. The tests you wrote to test talking to the
library, are they not written in JUnit?

Even if they are not, what problem do you have because they are not
written in JUnit? What are they written in?

>Can anybody provide me a good link on JNI testing or has someone 
>experienced similar problems? 

Not me. I hope someone else has links for you and I hope Mike puts them
into our FAQ. :)
